intro: Pachystelis jimenezii, commonly known as the Jimenez's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry, harsh environments. Pachystelis jimenezii plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly butterflies and bees.
